title: How Many Calories in Water?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in water—spoiler: zero! Get full nutrition breakdown per 100 ml, equivalents, and tweaks for flavored variations.
assumptions: Pure, plain water (still or sparkling); no additives, minerals, or flavors included.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by source (tap vs. bottled) and any added minerals or flavors; pure water is calorie-free. Check labels for enhanced waters.

quick_answer.text: Water has zero calories, making it the ultimate hydrator with no nutritional impact.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison; water contributes no macros or micros.

tweaks.label: Infuse with cucumber and mint per 100 ml
Mix with 1 tsp sugar per 100 ml

faqs.a: Zero calories in pure water, regardless of amount.
Plain sparkling water has 0 calories, just like still water.

faqs.q: Are there calories in mineral water?
faqs.a: Typically 0 calories, though trace minerals add negligible sodium.
Flavored or vitamin-enhanced waters can have 0–10 kcal per 100 ml from sweeteners.

faqs.q: Why drink water for weight loss?
faqs.a: Zero calories help replace higher-calorie drinks, aiding hydration without energy intake.
